title: bitcub
author: bitcub
content: I always got an error, Bitcointalk image proxy invalid image.So what is the best image hosting site to use that will not conflict with bitcointalk proxy thing

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Upload your image to https://talkimg.com and once you’re done you should get a BBcode link with the tag, so all you have to do is to come to the forum and paste it.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: One of bitcointalk members launched image hosting site after imgur stopped working, TalkImg.com - Image hosting for BitcoinTalk which is the one I would recommend, just keep in mind that you can use it for bitcointalk only. Alternatively, you can also use https://imgbb.com/ or https://postimages.org/ (this is the one I use for the other sites).

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Upload the image again using https://talkimg.com and you should copy the BBcode when done uploading the image. Go back to the forum where you are going to post the image and make sure to use the correct BBcode for it. One more thing, make sure the link of the image ends with image format such as .jpg, .jpeg. The BBcode for displaying image is shown below, It is also possible to resize the image.Code:[img]Image Link here.jpg[/img]Code:[img width=size number height=size number]Image Link here.jpg[/img][/cose]

comments.author: Litzki1990
comments.body: After the new update, uploading photos to Bitcoin Talk Forum is easy with talkimg.com  Entering talkimg.com and selecting the photo you want to upload, you have to paste and post the photo link according to the specific rules of the forum, only then your uploaded photo will be visible in the forum.

comments.author: Bureau
comments.body: Quote from: nakamura12 on October 03, 2023, 08:21:58 PMCode:[img]Image Link here.jpg[/img]Code:[img width=size number height=size number]Image Link here.jpg[/img][/cose]TalkImg is not like Imgur, you do not need to add BBcode manually as it provides you with those links. After uploading the image, click on the first drop-down menu where it says Embed codes and you get the image link with BB codes.  TalkImg was created by joker_josue keeping in mind the issues faced by users of Bitcointalk. It is so simple to use, even if someone does not have a clue how to use BBcode they can still use it with some understanding. The recommended image extension would be PNG and not JPG.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Quote from: Bureau on October 05, 2023, 01:20:47 PMTalkImg was created by joker_josue keeping in mind the issues faced by users of Bitcointalk. It is so simple to use, even if someone does not have a clue how to use BBcode they can still use it with some understanding. The recommended image extension would be PNG and not JPG.  I haven't use talkimg yet and I am open to a correction if I am wrong. In that case, the BBcode I have shared will be an additional information for OP in case he doesn't know about that and how to resize. It never hurts to know about what code to use and it also won't work if it doesn't end in image format not that talkimg doesn't end with it. It is also helpful if you aren't using talkimg where you need to type it yourself before it will work or the image will display.
